info.name: Wildscapes
info.attribution:
The room layout and game design are by LawDawg96 and are released to the Public Domain under CC0. The following items are available under the Pixabay license:
  • Landscape background by 12019, https://pixabay.com/photos/river-mountains-sunset-dusk-1589616/
  • Raindrops background by Leohoho, https://pixabay.com/photos/rain-water-raindrops-droplets-5470471/
The following items are available under the Flaticon license:

  • Bear by Rikas Dzihab, https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/bear_11957630
  • Elk by Bloodline Studios, https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/animal_13272945
  • Fox by Smashicons, https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/fox_3547065
  • Hawk by Meiliastudio, https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/eagle_14099016
  • Fish by Cuputo, https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/koi-fish_7309072
  • Pine cone colored by dreamicons, https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/pine-cone_3373670
  • Pine cone outline by dreamicons, https://www.flaticon.com/free-icon/pine-cone_3373673
The habitat tiles were created using the Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.midjourney.com/home/, using the following prompt: "top down view of [type of habitat] style of Claude Monet"

The library image was generated using the following Midjourney prompt: "bear and hawk fighting over salmon, partly cloudy day, mountains in background, oil on canvas."
info.description: Draft tokens and lay tiles to create the highest scoring wildlife habitat.

info.helpText:
Players take seats.  Press the restart button in the upper right corner. Select scoring options.  The board is set up automatically based on the number of seated players.

A random player is chosen to go first. Move the starting 3-piece tile to a place on the board. Move the colored marble to the area near the starting tile to help players distinguish between tile groups.

Hover over the scoring goal tiles partially displayed in the bottom-right to enlarge the view and see all of the text.

Manually drag pine cones to the holder near your seat when allowed by the rules. Drag them back to the main holder when spending them.

Manually move habitat tiles and animal tokens as needed. Click habitat tiles to rotate them. If swapping animal tokens when allowed by the rules, temporarily move them to the board. Press the "fill" button to reload the drafting area's token. Move the replaced tokens back to the small animal token bag.

At any time, press the "fill" button to reload missing pieces from the draft area. If playing in solo mode, tiles and tokens on the far right will be removed from the board, other tiles shifted to the right, and new tiles added to the left.

Pres the "turn" button at the end of your turn to change the turn indicator. This also activates the "fill" button so you do not need to use both.

The entire play area can be moved. When dragging the play area, it scales down so you can see more of the board. When you stop dragging, it returns to its original size. Click the "center" button to return the board to its starting position.

When the game is over, press the scoreboard icon to alternately display or hide the scoreboard. The scoreboard can be moved by dragging. Input scores by clicking on the scoreboard and entering points for each of the scorable areas. You can only do one entry at a time and must select the appropriate row from the drop-down menu each time.

fields.text: This will reset the game. Choose a scoring option then press Confirm to continue or Cancel to exit.

bearA.title: Bear
bearA.subTitle: Mating Pairs
bearA.content:
PairsPoints

319
427

Score for number of pairs of adjacent bears with no other adjacent bears.

bearB.title: Bear
bearB.subTitle: Mother & Cubs
bearB.content: 10 points per group of 3 adjacent bears (any shape) with no other adjacent bears.

bearC.subTitle: Families

12
25

Score per group of adjacnet bears (any shape) with no other adjacent bears. +3 points for having all group sizes.

elkA.subTitle: Lines
elkA.content:
ElkPoints
12
25
39
413

Score for number of elk in a straight line (flat side touching flat side) in any orientation. Count each elk only once. Groups may be adjacent.

elkB.subTitle: Formation
elkB.content:
FormationPoints
2
5
9
13
Score for each exact shape (any orientation). Count each elk only once. Groups may be adjacent.

hawkC.title: Hawk
hawkC.subTitle: Network
hawkC.content: 3 points for each line of sight between two non-adjacent hawks. Each hawk may have multiple lines of sight.

hawkD.subTitle: Territorial
hawkD.content:
AnimalsPoints
14
27
3+9

Score for each pair of non-adjacent hawks the number of unique animal types between them (excluding other hawks). Each hawk can only be part of one pair.

salmonD.title: Salmon
salmonD.subTitle: Surrounded
salmonD.content: For each group of at least 3 adjacent salmon in any shape, score 1 point for each salmon plus 1 point for each animal adjacent to the run. Salmon runs may not be adjacent.
